parsedComplaintsResult.issueCategory: Front End Wobble/Steering Stem Bearing Failure
parsedComplaintsResult.impact: The front end wobble can cause loss of control, accidents, and injuries, especially when decelerating or cornering.
symptoms: The front end wobbles or shakes when decelerating

parsedComplaintsResult.impact: The front end wobble/vibration can cause loss of control, accidents, and potentially lead to injuries or fatalities, especially when decelerating from high speeds.
symptoms: The front end of the motorcycle wobbles or vibrates when decelerating from 30-50 mph
and can cause uneven tire wear.

parsedComplaintsResult.impact: The failure of the flange bearings can cause the rear wheel to lock up, leading to loss of control, accidents, and potentially fatalities, especially when driving at high speeds.
symptoms: The flange bearings are rough turning
and one bearing is falling apart
causing the rear wheel to lock up.

parsedComplaintsResult.impact: The inaccuracy of the speedometer and odometer can cause the rider to misjudge their speed, leading to accidents, and affect the value of the motorcycle due to incorrect mileage.
symptoms: and the odometer is off by over 5%

parsedComplaintsResult.impact: An inaccurate speedometer reading can cause a distraction to the rider, leading to accidents or near-misses, as they need to constantly calculate their actual speed while driving. This can also lead to road rage, tailgating, and unsafe passing by other drivers.
symptoms: The speedometer reads 10% higher than the actual speed
requiring the rider to constantly calculate their actual speed
leading to distraction and potential accidents.
